creator: shanji_mmx@sohu.com
text:
1/tomcat 5.5.17 report the following error when configured as multi-virtual 
hosts.
org.apache.jasper.JasperException: Unable to compile class for JSP

An error occurred at line: 42 in the jsp file: ***.jsp
Generated servlet error:
*** cannot be resolved to a type

2/The same code can run well when there is only one host in server.xml of 
tomcat 5.5.17
3/The same code can run well when tomcat 5.0 run as multi-virtual hosts.

This looks like some form of configuration error. Please use the users mailing
list to debug.
creator: markt@apache.org

text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> This looks like some form of configuration error. Please use the users mailing
> list to debug.

Maybe, when I set the appBase parameter to "webapps" in the second <Host>, 
Tomcat run well. And I think it isn't a bug of virtualHost , it may be a bug of 
configuration, because even if there is only one Host, when I set the appBase 
parameter to other value but not "webapps", tomcat 5.5.17 also report the same 
error.

thanks
creator: shanji_mmx@sohu.com

text:
Bugzilla is not a support forum. Please follow my previous request and ask your
configuration questions on the users list.
creator: markt@apache.org
